intro: Matricaria confusa, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like white flowers with a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is widely used in aromatherapy and herbal medicine.
